questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹The sun __________ in the east. (sets / rises / hides)
²I need to buy a __________ of bread from the bakery. (bottle / loaf / carton)
³She is very __________ and always helps people in need. (selfish / kind / mean)
⁴Can you __________ the music? It's too loud. (turn down / turn on / turn up)
⁵My appointment is __________ 10:30 AM. (on / at / in)
⁶This is the __________ movie I have ever seen. I loved it! (best / worse / bad)
⁷I don't have __________ money with me right now. (many / a lot / much)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹rises, ²loaf, ³kind, ⁴turn down, ⁵at, ⁶best, ⁷much

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹A __________ is a place where you can see historical artifacts. (cinema / library / museum)
²He felt __________ after running a marathon. (energized / exhausted / awake)
³This diamond is beautiful, but it's completely __________. (worthless / valuable / cheap)
⁴Don't forget to __________ your coat; it's cold outside. (take off / bring / wear)
⁵What's the __________ today? Is it the 15th? (time / day / date)
⁶The children are playing __________ in the garden. (sadly / happily / angrily)
⁷She __________ to the gym three times a week. (goes / is going / went)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹museum, ²exhausted, ³worthless, ⁴wear, ⁵date, ⁶happily, ⁷goes

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹The opposite of 'deep' is __________. (wide / high / shallow)
²I'm __________ to peanuts; I can't eat them. (allergic / immune / open)
³He is __________ for the meeting. We should start without him. (early / on time / late)
⁴My flight __________ at 8 PM tonight. (arrives / departed / departs)
⁵Would you like __________ cup of tea? (other / another / some)
⁶She speaks English very __________. (fluent / fluently / good)
⁷He is very __________. He never wants to work. (hardworking / active / lazy)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹shallow, ²allergic, ³late, ⁴departs, ⁵another, ⁶fluently, ⁷lazy

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹A year has twelve __________. (weeks / months / days)
²The food was __________. I don't recommend that restaurant. (delicious / awful / tasty)
³The water is boiling. You can put the __________ in now. (pasta / ice / salad)
⁴Please put the books back on the __________ when you're finished. (table / shelf / floor)
⁵I need to __________ an important phone call. (do / make / give)
⁶She is wearing a __________ red dress. (lovely / ugly / old)
⁷He is __________ than his older brother. (short / shorter / shortest)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹months, ²awful, ³pasta, ⁴shelf, ⁵make, ⁶lovely, ⁷shorter

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹I have an __________ for my final exam tomorrow. (interview / exam / appointment)
²The library is a very __________ place for studying. (noisy / quiet / chaotic)
³This knife is not sharp enough to __________ the tomato. (cut / break / cook)
⁴A __________ person is someone who makes you laugh. (serious / comedian / teacher)
⁵She is __________ about winning the competition. (pessimistic / optimistic / sad)
⁶You __________ drink and drive. It's illegal. (should / can / mustn't)
⁷He is an __________ at fixing computers. (amateur / expert / apprentice)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹exam, ²quiet, ³cut, ⁴comedian, ⁵optimistic, ⁶mustn't, ⁷expert

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹The train travels on a railway __________. (road / track / path)
²Her hair is not straight, it's __________. (long / curly / short)
³He was __________ because his team lost the game. (delighted / pleased / disappointed)
⁴My birthday is __________ August. (at / on / in)
⁵This is my favorite __________ of shoes. (pair / piece / set)
⁶The problem was __________ difficult, so I asked for help. (quite / easy / a bit)
⁷The opposite of 'polite' is __________. (kind / rude / friendly)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹track, ²curly, ³disappointed, ⁴in, ⁵pair, ⁶quite, ⁷rude

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹Can you please __________ the door? (open / eat / sit)
²He is __________ a blue T-shirt and jeans today. (wearing / using / having)
³The film was so __________ that I fell asleep. (exciting / interesting / boring)
⁴If it __________, we will have the picnic inside. (snows / rains / shines)
⁵She is the __________ intelligent student in the class. (more / much / most)
⁶I don't like __________ food; it's too hot for me. (mild / sweet / spicy)
⁷A __________ is a person who flies an airplane. (doctor / pilot / driver)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹open, ²wearing, ³boring, ⁴rains, ⁵most, ⁶spicy, ⁷pilot

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹He is __________ to his work and always does a good job. (dedicated / indifferent / lazy)
²My car is old, so I need to buy a __________ one. (new / used / ancient)
³I have to __________ up early tomorrow for my flight. (stay / wake / sleep)
⁴We live in a small apartment on the third __________. (level / ground / floor)
⁵This coffee is too __________. It needs sugar. (sweet / bitter / sour)
⁶They have __________ to Paris several times. (be / been / being)
⁷He is not very __________. He doesn't like parties. (shy / sociable / quiet)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹dedicated, ²new, ³wake, ⁴floor, ⁵bitter, ⁶been, ⁷sociable

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹A vegetarian is someone who doesn't eat __________. (vegetables / fruit / meat)
²The box is __________; there is nothing inside it. (heavy / full / empty)
³She is very __________ and always has a smile on her face. (miserable / cheerful / serious)
⁴I need to __________ my homework before I can watch TV. (make / do / go)
⁵This is a __________ area. You must not smoke here. (smoking / non-smoking / free)
⁶The opposite of 'beautiful' is __________. (lovely / pretty / ugly)
⁷I __________ that movie last week. (saw / seen / see)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹meat, ²empty, ³cheerful, ⁴do, ⁵non-smoking, ⁶ugly, ⁷saw

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹He works as a __________ in a famous restaurant. (chef / waiter / customer)
²The weather is __________ and sunny, a perfect day for the beach. (cold / warm / stormy)
³I am __________ in learning how to play the guitar. (interesting / bored / interested)
⁴Please be __________ in the library. (loud / quiet / noisy)
⁵She is a very __________ person; she can lift heavy boxes. (weak / strong / small)
⁶There isn't __________ milk left in the carton. (any / some / many)
⁷He is __________ about the future of his company. (worried / calm / excited)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹chef, ²warm, ³interested, ⁴quiet, ⁵strong, ⁶any, ⁷worried

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹A __________ is an animal that barks. (cat / horse / dog)
²He is always __________ for work, never late. (behind / on time / after)
³The surface of the old table was __________, not smooth. (soft / rough / flat)
⁴I need to __________ an email to my boss. (read / write / listen)
⁵The opposite of 'brave' is __________. (strong / fearless / cowardly)
⁶She has a __________ collection of rare stamps. (valuable / worthless / common)
⁷He is __________ of spiders. (fond / happy / afraid)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹dog, ²on time, ³rough, ⁴write, ⁵cowardly, ⁶valuable, ⁷afraid

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹London is the __________ of the United Kingdom. (country / capital / continent)
²This medicine has a very __________ taste. (delicious / unpleasant / sweet)
³You should be __________ to your elders. (disrespectful / rude / respectful)
⁴I __________ my keys and can't find them anywhere. (have lost / did lose / was losing)
⁵This chair is not very __________. My back hurts. (hard / comfortable / soft)
⁶The classroom was __________ with students. (crowded / empty / spacious)
⁷A __________ person gives a lot of money to charity. (stingy / generous / poor)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹capital, ²unpleasant, ³respectful, ⁴have lost, ⁵comfortable, ⁶crowded, ⁷generous

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹The Earth __________ around the Sun. (spins / rotates / revolves)
²This exercise is too __________ for me. I can't do it. (simple / easy / difficult)
³She felt very __________ before her big presentation. (calm / nervous / bored)
⁴My brother is a __________ in the army. (doctor / soldier / teacher)
⁵The __________ of the desert is very dry. (forest / climate / ocean)
⁶The opposite of 'ancient' is __________. (old / modern / historic)
⁷He __________ me a secret and told me not to tell anyone. (said / told / spoke)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹revolves, ²difficult, ³nervous, ⁴soldier, ⁵climate, ⁶modern, ⁷told

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹A __________ helps sick animals. (dentist / veterinarian / surgeon)
²The room was __________ dark, so I turned on the lights. (pitch / very / a bit)
³He is a very __________ worker and is often promoted. (lazy / efficient / slow)
⁴I need to __________ some money from the ATM. (deposit / withdraw / save)
⁵This story is not true; it's __________. (factual / real / fictional)
⁶She is wearing a beautiful __________ around her neck. (bracelet / ring / necklace)
⁷The test was surprisingly __________, and everyone passed. (hard / easy / tricky)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹veterinarian, ²pitch, ³efficient, ⁴withdraw, ⁵fictional, ⁶necklace, ⁷easy

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹You use a __________ to write on a blackboard. (pen / pencil / chalk)
²The soup is cold. Can you please __________ it up? (cool / heat / freeze)
³He is very __________. He talks all the time. (quiet / talkative / shy)
⁴The opposite of 'success' is __________. (victory / achievement / failure)
⁵I have been waiting for you __________ two hours. (since / for / at)
⁶The __________ of the mountain offers a fantastic view. (base / summit / side)
⁷She is __________ to finish the project by Friday. (expected / expecting / expects)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹chalk, ²heat, ³talkative, ⁴failure, ⁵for, ⁶summit, ⁷expected

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹The Pacific is the largest __________ on Earth. (river / lake / ocean)
²This fabric is very __________. It feels nice against the skin. (rough / coarse / soft)
³He is a very __________ person and can be trusted. (dishonest / unreliable / reliable)
⁴You need a __________ to open this locked door. (key / hammer / card)
⁵I am not __________ with the results of the experiment. (satisfied / satisfying / satisfy)
⁶The play was so __________ that the audience gave a standing ovation. (terrible / mediocre / captivating)
⁷The opposite of 'temporary' is __________. (short-term / permanent / brief)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹ocean, ²soft, ³reliable, ⁴key, ⁵satisfied, ⁶captivating, ⁷permanent

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹A __________ has a long trunk and big ears. (giraffe / monkey / elephant)
²The instructions were __________, and I got lost. (clear / simple / confusing)
³She is very __________. She gets angry easily. (calm / patient / short-tempered)
⁴He decided to __________ his old car and buy a new one. (keep / sell / repair)
⁵It is __________ to see a rainbow after it rains. (rare / common / impossible)
⁶The steak was __________ and hard to chew. (tender / tough / soft)
⁷They live in a __________ cottage in the countryside. (huge / modern / charming)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹elephant, ²confusing, ³short-tempered, ⁴sell, ⁵common, ⁶tough, ⁷charming

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹The opposite of 'entrance' is __________. (exit / door / gate)
²This puzzle is __________. I can't figure it out. (easy / perplexing / obvious)
³He is __________ about his appearance and always looks smart. (careless / meticulous / messy)
⁴A __________ is used for measuring temperature. (ruler / thermometer / watch)
⁵She has a __________ voice, perfect for singing opera. (weak / powerful / quiet)
⁶I need to __________ my phone. The battery is low. (break / charge / throw)
⁷The company made a __________ profit last year. (huge / small / tiny)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹exit, ²perplexing, ³meticulous, ⁴thermometer, ⁵powerful, ⁶charge, ⁷huge

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹He is the __________ of the local newspaper. (writer / editor / reader)
²The opposite of 'wise' is __________. (intelligent / smart / foolish)
³The mirror has a crack, but it is still __________. (broken / usable / useless)
⁴She felt a great sense of __________ after finishing her degree. (sadness / relief / stress)
⁵The __________ on that mountain is very steep. (slope / peak / base)
⁶His excuse for being late was not __________. (believable / true / false)
⁷The garden is full of __________ flowers. (dull / colorful / ugly)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹editor, ²foolish, ³usable, ⁴relief, ⁵slope, ⁶believable, ⁷colorful

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹The __________ is the joint that bends in the middle of your leg. (elbow / wrist / knee)
²He is very __________ and always considers other people's feelings. (thoughtless / inconsiderate / thoughtful)
³The city is known for its __________ nightlife. (boring / quiet / vibrant)
⁴Please __________ from touching the exhibits in the museum. (continue / refrain / start)
⁵The opposite of 'victory' is __________. (success / triumph / defeat)
⁶Her performance was __________. There were no mistakes. (flawless / flawed / average)
⁷The old castle is now a popular tourist __________. (trap / attraction / spot)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹knee, ²thoughtful, ³vibrant, ⁴refrain, ⁵defeat, ⁶flawless, ⁷attraction

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹A __________ is a large body of salt water, smaller than an ocean. (river / sea / pond)
²His handwriting is almost __________. I can't read it. (legible / neat / illegible)
³She is __________ to accept the job offer. (hesitant / certain / sure)
⁴The opposite of 'courage' is __________. (bravery / valor / cowardice)
⁵The new law will be __________ starting next month. (effective / ineffective / useless)
⁶This is a __________ document. Please handle it with care. (public / common / confidential)
⁷He gave a __________ sigh of disappointment. (loud / deep / small)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹sea, ²illegible, ³hesitant, ⁴cowardice, ⁵effective, ⁶confidential, ⁷deep

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹The __________ of the tree provides shade. (leaves / roots / trunk)
²He is __________ of speaking five languages. (able / capable / skilled)
³The opposite of 'compulsory' is __________. (required / mandatory / voluntary)
⁴The antique vase is extremely __________. (fragile / strong / sturdy)
⁵The evidence against him was __________. (weak / overwhelming / scarce)
⁶She has a __________ memory for details. (poor / remarkable / bad)
⁷The debate became quite __________ as they disagreed. (calm / peaceful / heated)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹leaves, ²capable, ³voluntary, ⁴fragile, ⁵overwhelming, ⁶remarkable, ⁷heated

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹The __________ is the red liquid that circulates in the body. (water / blood / sweat)
²His decision was __________ and not based on logic. (rational / arbitrary / sensible)
³The opposite of 'abundant' is __________. (plentiful / ample / scarce)
⁴The defendant was found __________ by the jury. (innocent / guilty / correct)
⁵The politician's speech was very __________. (boring / persuasive / weak)
⁶She is known for her __________ sense of style. (impeccable / terrible / poor)
⁷The project requires a __________ amount of work. (considerable / minor / small)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹blood, ²arbitrary, ³scarce, ⁴innocent, ⁵persuasive, ⁶impeccable, ⁷considerable

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹The __________ system connects all the computers in the office. (solar / network / road)
²The opposite of 'transparent' is __________. (clear / see-through / opaque)
³He made a __________ attempt to fix the problem, but failed. (successful / futile / strong)
⁴The twins are so __________ it's hard to tell them apart. (different / opposite / identical)
⁵The company is facing __________ competition from its rivals. (friendly / fierce / weak)
⁶Her contribution to the team was __________. (invaluable / worthless / minor)
⁷The storm caused __________ damage to the coastal towns. (minimal / extensive / slight)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹network, ²opaque, ³futile, ⁴identical, ⁵fierce, ⁶invaluable, ⁷extensive

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹The __________ is the outer layer of the Earth. (core / mantle / crust)
²The opposite of 'native' is __________. (local / indigenous / foreign)
³His alibi was __________ and confirmed by two witnesses. (shaky / weak / solid)
⁴The new discovery was a major __________ in the field of medicine. (setback / breakthrough / problem)
⁵She is a __________ supporter of environmental protection. (staunch / weak / wavering)
⁶The details of the plan are still __________. (clear / final / tentative)
⁷He has a __________ talent for music. (mediocre / prodigious / average)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹crust, ²foreign, ³solid, ⁴breakthrough, ⁵staunch, ⁶tentative, ⁷prodigious

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹A __________ is a period of ten years. (century / millennium / decade)
²The opposite of 'flexible' is __________. (adaptable / pliable / rigid)
³The witness gave a __________ account of the events. (vague / precise / unclear)
⁴The negotiations between the two countries reached a __________. (stalemate / agreement / conclusion)
⁵He is known for his __________ and witty remarks. (dull / boring / sarcastic)
⁶The __________ of the city are concerned about pollution. (visitors / tourists / inhabitants)
⁷Her knowledge of the subject is __________. (superficial / deep / basic)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹decade, ²rigid, ³vague, ⁴stalemate, ⁵sarcastic, ⁶inhabitants, ⁷superficial

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹The doctor gave her a __________ for her illness. (receipt / prescription / note)
²The opposite of 'humble' is __________. (modest / meek / arrogant)
³The artist's work is highly __________ and original. (derivative / conventional / innovative)
⁴The soldier showed great __________ in the face of danger. (fear / cowardice / valor)
⁵The meeting has been __________ until next week. (advanced / postponed / cancelled)
⁶His speech had a __________ effect on the audience. (profound / minor / negligible)
⁷The evidence was __________ and led to a conviction. (inconclusive / conclusive / weak)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹prescription, ²arrogant, ³innovative, ⁴valor, ⁵postponed, ⁶profound, ⁷conclusive

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹A __________ is a person who is fleeing their country. (tourist / refugee / expatriate)
²The opposite of 'cautious' is __________. (careful / prudent / reckless)
³The painting was a __________ of a famous masterpiece. (forgery / original / print)
⁴There is a __________ of skilled workers in the industry. (surplus / shortage / plenty)
⁵His comments were __________ and not relevant to the topic. (pertinent / extraneous / central)
⁶The two companies decided to __________ and form a larger one. (split / merge / compete)
⁷The government's response to the crisis was widely __________. (praised / criticized / ignored)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹refugee, ²reckless, ³forgery, ⁴shortage, ⁵extraneous, ⁶merge, ⁷criticized

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹The study of the stars and planets is called __________. (geology / astrology / astronomy)
²The opposite of 'benign' is __________. (kind / harmless / malignant)
³The peace treaty was __________ after months of negotiation. (broken / ratified / discussed)
⁴She has an __________ ability to learn languages. (ordinary / uncanny / average)
⁵The atmosphere in the room was __________ with tension. (calm / relaxed / fraught)
⁶The lawyer found a __________ in the contract. (strength / loophole / clause)
⁷The problem is __________ and affects the entire community. (isolated / personal / widespread)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹astronomy, ²malignant, ³ratified, ⁴uncanny, ⁵fraught, ⁶loophole, ⁷widespread

questions.instructions: Complete the sentences with the correct word(s).

qa_pairs.item:
¹A __________ is a book written by someone about their own life. (biography / novel / autobiography)
²The opposite of 'ephemeral' is __________. (transient / fleeting / everlasting)
³The team's morale was __________ after the unexpected defeat. (high / boosted / low)
⁴He is known for his __________ and fair judgments. (biased / partial / impartial)
⁵The old traditions are beginning to __________. (thrive / flourish / fade away)
⁶The __________ between the two events is not a coincidence. (correlation / difference / separation)
⁷The situation requires __________ action. (delayed / immediate / postponed)
qa_pairs.answer: ¹autobiography, ²everlasting, ³low, ⁴impartial, ⁵fade away, ⁶correlation, ⁷immediate
